title: What are the transplantable organs in the human body? When was such transplantation done for the first time in the world? - Quora

response.answer_text: quite a few organs in the body are transplantable. Skin grafts, cornea of the eye, spleen, heart, liver etc. the difficulty is in finding a good match to prevent rejection of the graft/transplant. the oldest transplant in written scriptures is a nose skin flap by Sushruta in 7th / 8th century bc

The first successful organ transplant was a kidney transplant at the Brigham and Women’s Hospital in 1954, in Boston. See Kidney Transplant History at BWH About organs Organ Donation Facts & Info | Organ Transplants
